The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that an ancient evil is with them. Just when you think it can’t get worse than that group has to face giant aquatic creatures that can only be described as walking dinosaur heads.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back again to watch it.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the success of The A-Team and Commando, released two years before Ninja and Eighties machine gun TV series The Running Man with Arnold Schwarzenegger at its biggest peak.
This is a low budget actioner with all of the requisite cheese,
